description:
pkg: misc doc cleanup

Use "returns true if" consistently to describe functions returning bool.
The "whether" constructs are too easy for me to misread (as "it does x
whether or not condition is true") and seem awkward.

Also tweaked surrounding docs in a few places.

messages.text:
rsc and i chatted about this and have a new plan that will float out tomorrow.

-rob

Hello r (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

LGTM (fwiw)

Is it a goal to describe all documented boolean functions with "returns true if", or just the ones that previously used "whether"?

subject: code review 4551089: pkg: misc doc cleanup
